jobs.title: Breast Cancer Tissue Engineer
jobs.description:
Please send resume to careers@pearbio.com.

About Pear Bio
Get the right cancer treatment the first time.
At Pear, we’re ditching the traditional guessing game -  which is full of trial and error - and are personalising cancer treatment selection because every cancer is unique. To achieve this, we’ve developed a medical device that cultures patient tumour samples and identifies the best treatment for that patient.
We are a VC-backed startup based in London. To grow our business, we’re looking for a breast cancer tissue engineer to join our early-stage team. Will you be the one?

Breast Cancer Tissue Engineer Job Description
For breast cancer, we’re starting with triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). You will research and implement protocols for culturing primary tumour cells in hydrogels and microfluidic devices. This ex vivo platform will test FDA-approved cancer treatments and single out the best one for each patient. 
You will start with cell lines for early-stage R&D. Then you will have access to primary tumour samples for pre-clinical and clinical trials, where you will test and rank 5 FDA-approved treatments. You will also optimise the protocols for cell culture and treatment assessment. You will also be in charge of finalising the protocols for an independent clinical trial. 

Job Responsibilities
- Culture cell lines and primary patient tumour samples 
- Develop tumour engineering protocols that can be replicated in clinical labs
- Operate a microfluidic device and test FDA-approved anti-cancer drugs on tumour samples
- Test experimental therapies for pharmaceutical companies
- Conduct various genotypic and phenotypic assays
- Work on preclinical trials with triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)
- Develop protocols and best practices for independent clinical trials

Must-Haves:
- Master’s in the life sciences or engineering
- Experience in handling/culturing primary human cells, particularly tumour samples
- Experience in running various phenotypic and genotypic assays
- Published papers in the life sciences
- 2+ years of work experience in cancer research or tissue engineering

Nice-to-Haves:
- PhD in the life sciences or engineering 
- Experience in clinical trials 

What’s in it for You
- London lab space
- Competitive compensation in line with industry standards
- Potential stock options in a growing startup
- Open work environment where your opinions are valued
- High career growth in a fast-paced environment

jobs.title: Immuno-Oncology/Immunotherapy Research Scientist
jobs.description:
Immuno-Oncology/Immunotherapy Research Scientist Job Description
You will develop an in vitro model for testing immunotherapies. Currently, Pear’s proprietary organ-on-a-chip contains a solid tumour module and a liver module, with an injection circuit to circulate blood and drugs. First, you will incorporate immune cells (e.g., T cells) into the chip and test existing immunotherapies (e.g. CAR T-cell therapies, immune checkpoint inhibitors) to verify the accuracy of the model. Later, you will test new immunotherapies from pharma companies for their R&D. 

Job Responsibilities
- Handle patient tumour and blood samples
- Co-culture cancer and immune cells 
-  Operate a microfluidic device 
-  Test immunotherapies using various phenotypic and genotypic assays, including 3D imaging and cell viability assays
-  Create assay protocols for commercial drug testing services
-  Translate research into animal/human trials for personalised medicine

Must-Haves:
- Master’s or greater in the life sciences
- Experience in handling/culturing human cells, particularly immune cells
- Experience in handling human blood
- Experience in oncology and/or immunology
- Experience in running various phenotypic and genotypic assays
- Published papers in the life sciences

Nice-to-Haves:
- PhD in the life sciences 
- Experience in animal/clinical trials
- Experience in CAR T-cell therapy and immune checkpoint inhibitor
- 2+ years of work experience in cancer research, immunology, or tissue engineering

What’s in it for You:
- London office/lab space
- Competitive compensation 
- Potential stock options in a growing startup
- An open work environment where your opinions are valued
- Potential for high career growth in a fast-paced environment

Please note:
- We are unable to sponsor work visas at this time. Please confirm your ability to work in the UK without sponsorship before applying.
- The position is not eligible for remote work. If you are not based out of London, you will be expected to relocate.

Interested? Send your resume to careers@pearbio.com

jobs.title: Microfluidics Engineer
jobs.description:
Microfluidics Engineer

The microfluidics engineer will design and optimize Pear’s current organ-on-a-chip (OOC), which contains a tumor module, a liver module, and connects to a pump system that circulates blood and drugs. Using as few cancer cells as possible, the OOC must maximize the accuracy of drug testing compared to humans. It must also be able to culture patient-derived tumors and perform to rank treatment regimens to identify the most effective options.

The microfluidics engineer will collaborate with tissue engineers and manufacturers in studies to test FDA approved therapies on primary tumors to identify the best treatments for each patient. Using as few cancer cells as possible, they will optimize the microfluidic chip design and the accuracy of drug testing.

Job Responsibilities: 

- Design and optimize the Organ on a Chip (OOC)	
- Work with contract manufacturer to fabricate clinical-grade chips and microfluidic devices for internal R&D, preclinical and clinical trials and sales
- Develop device characterization, assembly and operation manual for internal R&D, independent trials and the FDA
- Manage hardware documentation and design history files
- Create labeling and packaging for device and consumable kits
 
Must-Haves:

- Bachelor’s in Engineering
- Experience in designing and fabricating microfluidic devices
- Experience in hardware manufacturing
- Launched products or published papers in microfluidics,  life sciences or chemical engineering
- 2+ years of industry work experience in microfluidics or life sciences
Nice-to-Haves:
- PhD in Life Sciences or Engineering
- Experience in clinical trials
- Experience working in manufacturing facilities
- Experience in handling/culturing human primary tumor cells~

What’s in it for You:

- London office/lab space
- Competitive compensation in line with industry standards
- Potential stock options in a growing startup
- An open work environment where your opinions are valued
- Potential for high career growth in a fast-paced environment

Salary:

If interested, send your resume to careers@pearbio.com

Please note:

We are unable to sponsor work visas at this time. Please confirm your ability to work in the UK without sponsorship before applying.
The position is not eligible for remote work. If you are not based out of London, you will be expected to relocate.
